result.execSummary:
The defendant Kurtis S. Cline was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

from Atty Bennett concerning sentence credit

10:47 am - Defendant Kurtis S. Cline in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Kurtis S. Cline in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf57, 14cf106 and 14cf115.  In case 14cf106 - State stipulates defendant returned vehicle within 24 hours undamaged.  State moves to amend Count 1 to a Class A Misdemeanor and Dismiss but read in count 2 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to Counts 1 and 3.  In case 14cf115 - State moves to Dismiss but read in Count 3 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to counts 1 and 2.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Bednar/Bennett/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.

Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Sig bond returned from jail - defendant refused to sign.

02:39 pm - Defendant Kurtis S. Cline in court with attorney Brian F Bennett.  Defendant Kurtis S. Cline in custody.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf106 (AIA) and 14cf115 (Init).  In 14cf106 -   In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Bennett statement to modify bond.  Court denies.    In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Michlig/Bennett to bond.  Court sets sig bond in 14cf115.  
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 11:00 am.
